In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= "$word "
    end
    # handle the last line after loop ends
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Now let's test this function:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed non risus."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This will print:

```
Lorem ipsum 
dolor sit 
amet, 
consectetur 
adipiscing 
elit. Sed 
non risus.
```
